çŸ® (Çi)

Means short in height, low in stature, or small in size. It specifically refers to the vertical dimension of an object or a person's height.



çŸ­ (duÇn)

Means short in length or duration, or brief in time. It specifically refers to the horizontal dimension of an object or a person's length.



For example, you could use çŸ® (Çi) to describe a person's height, but you would use çŸ­ (duÇn) to describe the length of a skirt or the duration of a movie.

å¸®å¿™ (bÄngmÃ¡ng)

Means to help or assist with a specific task or favor. It is used in the context of providing aid or support for someone in completing a particular action or task.



å¸®åŠ© (bÄngzhÃ¹)

Also means to help or assist, but it is a more general term for providing help or assistance in any situation.



For example, you could use å¸®å¿™ (bÄngmÃ¡ng) when asking someone to help you move furniture, but you would use å¸®åŠ© (bÄngzhÃ¹) when talking about helping someone in need.

å˜åŒ– (biÃ nhuÃ )

æ¢ (huÃ n)

Means to exchange, replace, or switch. It specifically refers to the action of replacing one thing with another.

å·® (chÃ )

Means different, distinct, or disparate. It can also mean to lack or be deficient in something.



å (huÃ i)

Means bad, negative, or unfavorable. It specifically refers to the quality or condition of something being undesirable or not in good condition.



For example, you could use å·® (chÃ ) to describe the difference between two options, but you would use å (huÃ i) to describe the quality of a product or the condition of a situation.

è®² (jiÇng)

Means to speak, talk, or give a speech. It is often used in the context of delivering a lecture, presentation, or formal speech.



è¯´ (shuÅ)

Means to speak, say, or talk. It is a more general term and can be used in various contexts, such as everyday conversation, storytelling, or expressing an opinion.



For example, you would use è®² (jiÇng) when referring to giving a lecture or presentation, while è¯´ (shuÅ) is used in everyday conversation or when expressing thoughts or opinions.
